alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 4:58PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Bucks, Montgomery, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 456 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.0 inches are possible across portions of the advised area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Bensalem, Bristol, Hatboro, Jenkintown, Rockledge, Abington, Langhorne, Bryn Athyn, Ivyland, Feasterville, and Feasterville-Trevose. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 340 and 358. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 30 and 40. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
